resources.string: The introduced email is not registered.
Please, fill in all the fields.
Before starting, fill in the following fields:
IPSAQ\'s questionnaire consists of 32 questions. For each question you answer you will unlock a new piece of a 9 pieces puzzle.
Guess what the puzzle is hiding in order to see the full image and move on to the next one.
You can quit the questionnaire at any time and get back to it later at the point where you left it
When you have finished, you will have to guess what is the concept that relates all the images you have seen. ¡The more puzzles you have guessed the easier it will be!
But don\'t leave without knowing your results!
Are you an internal, personal or situational attributor? Start the questionaire and find out!
You can start your first questionnaire. Take your time and respond honestly. ¿Are you ready?
You have a questionnaire started! ¿Would you like to resume it?
You have completed your questionnaire! Send it and you will have access to the end of the game.
You have completed your questionnaire! Access the end of the game
You have completed your questionnaire! You can start a new one if you wish.
A friend gave you a lift home. What caused your friend to give you a lift home?
A friend talked about you behind your back. What caused your friend to talk about you behind your back?
A friend said that he(she) has no respect for you. What caused your friend to say that he(she) has no respect for you?
A friend helped you with the gardening. What caused your friend to help you with the gardening?
A friend thinks you are trustworthy. What caused your friend to think you are trustworthy?
A friend made an insulting remark to you. What caused your friend to insult you?
A friend bought you a present. What caused your friend to buy you a present?
A friend picked a fight with you. What caused your friend to fight with you?
A friend thinks you are dishonest. What caused your friend to think you are dishonest?
A friend refused to talk to you. What caused your friend to refuse to talk to you?
A friend thinks you are interesting. What caused your friend to think you are interesting?
A friend sent you a postcard. What caused your friend to send you a postcard?
A friend thinks you are unfriendly. What caused your friend to think that you are unfriendly?
A friend spent some time talking to you. What caused your friend to spend time talking with you?
A friend thinks you are clever. What caused your friend to think you are clever?
A friend thinks you are sensible. What caused your friend to think that you were sensible?
A friend refused to help you with a job. What caused your friend to refuse to help you with the job?
A friend thinks you are unfair. What caused your friend to think that you are unfair?
A friend said that he(she) dislikes you. What caused your friend to say that he(she) dislikes you?
A friend rang to enquire about you. What caused your friend to ring to enquire about you?
A friend ignored you. What caused your friend to ignore you?
A friend said that she(he) admires you. What caused your friend to say that she(he) admired you?
A friend said that he(she) finds you boring. What caused your friend to say that he(she) finds you boring?
A friend said that she(he) resents you. What caused your friend to say that she(he) resents you?
A friend visited you for a friendly chat. What caused your friend to visit you for a chat?
A friend believes that you are honest. What caused your friend to believe that you are honest?
A friend betrayed the trust you had in her. What caused your friend to betray your trust?
A friend ordered you to leave. What caused your friend to order you to leave?
A friend said that she(he) respects you. What caused your friend to say that she(he) respects you?
A friend thinks you are stupid. What caused your friend to think that you are stupid?
A friend said that he(she) liked you. What caused your friend to say that he(she) liked you?
A neighbour invited you in for a drink. What caused your friend to invite you in for a drink?
(Please write down the one major cause)
Something about the other person or other people ?
Something about the situation (circumstances or chance)?
How convinced are you that this is the one major cause?
For safety reasons, please choose a new password:
Please introduce your email to recover your account.
An error has occurred. Please try again later.
Could not connect to the server. Please try again later.
A mail has been sent to %1$s.
Do you know what it is?
You must complete all the question before continuing
You did not guess the image!
Continue answering questions and unlock more puzzle pieces!
The correct answer is: %1$s.\nContinue answering questions and unlock new puzzles!
You have finished your questionnaire! Now your answers will be sent and you will have access to the end of the game. Are you ready?
The correct answer is: %1$s.\nNow your answers will be sent and you will have access to the end of the game. Are you ready?
Now your answers will be sent and you will have access to the end of the game. Are you ready?
The correct answer is: %1$s. See the image before going to the end of the game.
Which concept relates all the above images? (one word)
The concept that relates all the words is: %1$s.\nThank you for completing the questionnaire. Access your results now.
The concept that relates all the words is: %1$s.\nThank you for completing the questionnaire. Access your results now.
You tend to attribute the causes of events to other people. That can lead you to wrong and paranoid thoughts about what other people think of you or their intentions. You have to work to improve it.
You tend to attribute the causes of events to yourself. This can cause you bad humour and even depression. You have to work to improve it.
You tend to attribute the causes of events to external circumstances. This is psycollogically benign, so congratulations! You have nothing to worry about.
